column4: i am in desperate need of help :(, amarok has decided to nuke all my music off of my ipod :(, all but 256 tracks :@ grrrrrrrrrrrr, this is first time i used linux with my ipod as i haven't trusted it not to mess it up and now it has on the first go :@, is there any way to recover these songs as i didnt have space to back them up from windows when converting from windows to linux so my only copy was on my ipod, thats 25gig of music ive lost if not, someone
please help me retrieve it back
you can use a windows reccovery program.  I would try to get an image of the ipod before going any further.
how would i go about doing that?
do you have a ms box available?
no :(
ive found a windows program that says it will recover songs from an ipod though, trying it through wine atm
program doesn runt under wine :(
true, will ave to go down a mates house, still annoying :(

just plugged my ipod back in, rythm box can see ALL the songs on it (and play them) only they arent all listed on my ipod, so it seems the ipod databse on the ipod has got corrupt? any way i can fix this?
I dont know about that, I would pull them with rythem and save them to your PC the when you push them back Ipod should see them
WIll acdeesee work under wine? There is an Ipod plugin for it that really works well..
not a clue, never used it before :), trying gtkpod see if its got anything in there that could fix it
can you mount it as a drive?
yes, ive got it mounted atm, rythmbox and gtkpod can see ALL my songs, but on my ipod i can only see a few....
since it is mounted you should be able to copy them to a different location
if worst comes to worst i will copy them off ipod to pc then back to ipod, but it means i will loose play counts, play lists etc
that is better than losing all your music..
definately :), cheers for ur help so far :()
I loaded up the wifes Ipod once and havent messed with it much since
lol
yes
